metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8844 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The signal implementation in the Linux kernel before 4.3.5 on powerpcplatforms does not check for an MSR with both the S and T bits set, whichallows local users to cause a denial of service (TM Bad Thing exception andpanic) via a crafted application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8844` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.3.0-5.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required
